items.description: River Cole, Dorcan Brook and South Marston Brook
items.message: This flood alert has been removed. The flood forecast has improved. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area this morning. Further rain is forecast this afternoon and and overnight. We will continue to monitor the rainfall and river levels. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
Due to heavy rain overnight tonight, 02/10/25 rising river levels may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest between 11:30 PM 02/10/25 and 3:30 AM on 03/10/2025.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck and other watercourses, from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston.
Further heavy rainfall is expected tomorrow along with strong winds as Storm Amy moves across Cumbria.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 03/10/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ehen, Rive Calder, River Irt, River Esk

items.message:
Flooding is possible as the river, and its streams may rise, due to heavy rain forecast overnight 02/10/2025.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk and other watercourses, from Harrington to Annaside including low lying areas around Whitehaven, Cleator Moor, Egremont, Gosforth, Eskdale and Bootle.
Flood risk will be elevated between 10:30 PM on 02/10/2025, and 3:00 AM on 03/10/2025.
More rain is forecast Friday as Storm Amy moves into the areaÂ so there is a risk of further flooding, and more land 
and properties becoming at risk.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Prepare now to keep you, precious items, and your property safe. Install flood protection, gather 
emergency supplies, pack a bag containing essentials and look out for further warnings.
This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 03/10/2025, or if the situation changes.
